newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up on commercials, Mexican rumour.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up on commercials, Mexican rumour.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended up on commercial demand and rumoured exports to Mexico, traders said.

"RBC-DS and UGG bought the August and talk one boat load of canola was sold to Mexico boosted August," a trader said. November WCE canola crush profit margins fell to -12.02 Wednesday from -8.31 Tuesday. About 300 Aug-Nov spread from $15 to $18.50. Volume was 2,705 lots, or 54,100 tonnes, with 350 hedges.
Commercials traded 200 November flax spread to November canola from $65 to $66.
August canola rose $8.90 to $363.20, November up $1.40 to $345.60. November flax up $1.20 to $280.90. Sep-Nov flax spread at $4. Volume was 475 lots.
October western barley rose $0.80 to $127, December up $0.50 to $128 on mixed local, commercial trade. About 200 Dec-Mar spread at $1. Volume was 775 lots.
October feed wheat was unchanged at $152.50, December up $0.10 to $153.10 on mixed local, commercial and commission trade. Volume was 187 lots. Oats and feed peas did not trade.
(All values in Canadian dollars except oats, feed peas).
